answerText: Confessions[10] Confessions was written by this Bishop of Hippo, the son of Saint Monica who also wrote The City of God.
heading: Michigan Fall Tournament |2013 | 1 | 4 | Literature | Classical | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: One section of this work considers its author's early sexual relationships as being a sinful way for him to manifest his desire for love and later discusses the purposeless theft of some pears. For 10 points each: [10] Name this book that reconsiders its author's earlier book The Beautiful and the Fitting and details its author's religious experiences under St. Ambrose in Milan.
